data.enText: the glass part that fits into an electric lamp, etc. to give light when it is switched on

data.chText: 只有光秃秃的电灯泡照明的屋子（无灯罩、灯饰）
data.enText: a room lit by bare bulbs (= with no decorative cover)
the round underground part of some plants, shaped like an onion , that grows into a new plant every year

data.chText: 鳞茎状物（如温度计的球部）
data.enText: an object shaped like a bulb , for example the end of a thermometer

means: 鳞茎状物(如温度计的球部)

tr: a rounded part of a cylindrical instrument (usually at one end)
electric lamp consisting of a transparent or translucent glass housing containing a wire filament (usually tungsten) that emits light when heated by electricity
a rounded dilation or expansion in a canal or vessel or organ
lower or hindmost part of the brain
(`bulb' is an old term for medulla oblongata)
example: the medulla oblongata is the most vital part of the brain because it contains centers controlling breathing and heart functioning

tr: a modified bud consisting of a thickened globular underground stem serving as a reproductive structure
anything with a round shape resembling a teardrop

value.def: A bulb is the glass part of an electric lamp, which gives out light when electricity passes through it.

example.ex: The stairwell was lit by a single bulb.
example.tran: 楼梯间只有一盏灯照明。

value.def: A bulb is a root shaped like an onion that grows into a flower or plant.

trans: 电灯泡；替换次级侧的电珠；电珠；灯泡
